Package io.github.JeremyBloom.mosdex2.dataframe

This package represents alternative implementations of the Dataframe interface.

A Dataframe is a fundamental component of MOSDEX, representing a data set of records that supports SQL queries. A Table's Instance field contains a Dataframe that holds its Records. Since Instances can potentially hold very large data sets, a basic challenge in implementing MOSDEX is how to efficiently read and process Instances. Our design philosophy is to use data structures that support big data operations from the outset to insure scalability of MOSDEX.

Currently, we are using Apache Spark to implement Dataframe, but we believe our design is adaptable to FLINK, or JDBC databases as well.

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    MsdxDataframe
    This interface provides a template for classes that represent a data set of records that supports SQL queries.
    MsdxDataframe.Factory
    The Dataframe Factory provides public methods for creating dataframes and executing queries.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    MsdxJavaDataframe
    A dummy Dataframe for testing purposes.
    MsdxJavaDataframe.Factory
    The Dataframe Factory provides public methods for creating Dataframes and executing queries.
    MsdxSparkDataframe
    Implements the Dataframe interface using a Apache Spark Dataset of Rows.
    MsdxSparkDataframe.Factory
    The Dataframe Factory provides public methods for creating dataframes and executing queries.
